revised_title: Diffraction of Light by Ultrasonic Waves: General Theory and Applications
tldr: This article presents a general theory for the diffraction of light by ultrasonic waves. The authors formulate the problem in terms of the scattering of electromagnetic waves by a periodically perturbed medium, leading to an integral equation. They solve this equation using a trial solution for the electric disturbance in the form of a double infinity of plane waves. The authors derive expressions for the intensities of the diffracted spectra and discuss various approximations and applications of their theory.
